description:
Amazing place!  They serve Mitchell Ice Cream!  Yummy!

Will be back again!  Favorite is mango and Ube ice cream.
author: Hanif S.

description:
Used to work a candy shop in Oregon in my teens that used to get their candies from Shaws of San Francisco. One of my favorites was the red licorice very fresh and chewy and very authentic tasting red licorice. I find myself traveling through San Francisco with a little extra time so I thought I would stop at Shaw's and get a taste of that old red licorice. So I called ahead to verify that they were still around and still carried red Licorice and the girl who answered assured me that yes they still sell red licorice. So I drove across town fighting with the traffic only to arrive at a tiny little candy shop. The girl behind the counter said "yes here's are red Licorice" ....and handed me red gum drops....
When I told her that wasn't red licorice she said that's all she knew. Then said that she had black licorice and pointed at the black gumdrops....
Congratulations on hiring the dumbest teenager in town.....
What a tremendous disappointment Shaw candies of San Francisco has become......
author: Leather M.

description: I am usually not the type to complain and have been a loyal Shaw's customer for years. I had a HORRIBLE situation with Shaw's where they had charged me over $180 for about $18 dollars of candy. The cashier who was an old man told me he would not charge me that $180 by handwriting on the receipt. Lo and behold I receive a $180 charge on my Bank of America.  I couldn't believe the guy lied to me! I called Shaw's several times and most often it went to voice mail. I visited the place five times. The first time they took the receipt away to notify their manager. Then claimed it was never received. They later reached out to me saying they will mail me the information and receipt. It never happened. I have never been so exhausted with the way Shaw's handles customer service. TAKE ACCOUNTABILITY!
author: Christine H.

description: Nice candy store that sells a lot of different types of candy and Mitchell's ice cream. They even have pez dispeners which was cool..., brought back childhood memories. I got the white chocolate haystack coconut and English toffee which were OK.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Given how long they've been around, and paired with how some folks will review anything and everything (like the Bay Bridge toll plaza), I find it hard to believe that Shaw's hasn't collected more than 124 reviews after all this time.  Beyond just being a West Portal institution, they've been around for over 85 years!   Kind of nice how, despite how much the city has changed over the last decade or so, some SF favorites have managed to stick around!

Walking into Shaw's, I imagine what kids nowadays see is very similar to what kids that came here in the 60's and 70's saw - shelves, racks, and display cases filled with housemade fudges, jelly beans, sweets, chocolates, gummies, and candies.  Sure, their sweets aren't the cheapest, but it's hard to beat their service and selection.  Years ago, when I was dating this girl who went off to study abroad in Korea, this was just about the only place I could find that sold the chocolate covered gummy bears I was looking to buy for her care package.

-- Some of their candy selection: (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/shaws-san-francisco-san-francisco?select=Yl-9IfLETlp1JmwI6qhimw)

Oddly though, despite all the enticing sweets that they sell, the real reason why I come to Shaw's is for the Mitchell's ice cream that they sell at the back of their shop.  They may not have all of the flavors to choose from, but coming here is so much easier than having to drive all of the way down to the Mission.  And when the craving strikes for a scoop of Grasshopper Pie ice cream, I don't want to have to drive that far to satisfy it!

-- Grasshopper Pie: (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/shaws-san-francisco-san-francisco?select=yjqLsZ6vcvI69sTC6StZ1w)

In all seriousness though, Shaw's is one of those vintage SF businesses that I truly hope is able to stick around for another 85 years.  At the risk of sounding like a cranky old man, while I certainly appreciate many aspects of the City's evolution over the last several years, it'd be sad to see another longtime favorite like this fold due to inflated rents and/or get evicted.  Really, neighborhood gems like Shaw's are becoming increasingly scarce, but I'll keep coming here for my Grasshopper Pie fix for as long as their doors stay open!
author: Mike L.

description:
I love this place in cute West Portal Avenue. They have fudge, cotton candy, Mitchell's ice cream, truffles, jelly beans and more. This looks like a cute mom and pop store that has been in
the area for years. It has a 50s diner feel. Like where Betty and Veronica would get their candy.

It surely satisfies my candy craving.  There are candies sold from long ago like Abba Zabba, Sugar Daddy and Pez. If you are looking for great candy gift items, this is the spot! Popular, fun boxed candies are for sale in addition to purchasing candies & chocolates by the pound.  

My boyfriend and I picked up some chocolate covered gummy bears, as well as some sour chewies and his favorite fudge.  They have an extensive chocolate collection (bridge mix, chocolate-covered-everything-you-want, etc.) so if you're in the mood for something sweet, stop by Shaw's and treat yourself to a variety of candies. It's great feeling like a kid again when I go to Shaw's. Five stars!
author: Maria M.

description:
Old school candy store with loads of eye and real candy. 

The ice cream is what we came after, and it tastes like it was home made in the best possible way. We had a chocolate caramel crunch and devoured it so quickly we did not pause for a photo!

Frozen custard like mouthfeel, exquisite caramel sauce with lush complex flavors. Excellent textures, bouquet and harmonious experience.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: They serve Mitchell's!  3 solid stars. I am writing this so it doesn't count as s tip
author: Fatty A.

description: Waited in line 10 minutes to order a sundae. Got to the front only to be told they we are not doing sundaes today with no logical reason. Done with Shaw's . Bummer, been going here since I was a child.
author: Terri T.

description:
West Portal is known in San Francisco as an older neighborhood with its old cafes and restaurants. Shaw' sits right in the middle of West Portal and offers a wide variety of chocolates, candies, jelly beans and yes Ice Cream!!!!!!

They serve Mitchell's Ice cream and have regular cones or waffle cones. Along with Ice cream they have slushes and my personal favorite Cotton Candy. 

I would strongly recommend anyone who is looking for a vintage candy store to go to Shaw's, it's easily accessible via the M line on the Muni. I know I will be back for a lot more of their Strawberry Ice cream and cotton candy ^_^
author: Jonathan B.

description: Let me clarify: Mitchell's ice cream is 5 stars!!! It was delicious. I'm giving this a 3 star review because of the horrible service given by the young blonde girl this evening. Firstly, she made 2 groups of us wait 3-5 minutes bc she had cleaned the floors (it was about 8:15pm and they close at 10pm. She probably started cleaning to get out sooner not expecting the rush of people). There was a family of 6 in front of us and she was as rude to them as us, and those behind us. She said they only take cash, which is not true. She even said "go outside to the atm at the bank and get cash". When asked if they don't have a machine, said yes they do but it's slow! She was soooooo lazy!!!! The machine was at the front of the store and she didn't want to walk back and forth but felt it was ok to tell customers to leave the store, get cash and come back. She also hesitated to give a receipt. What the heck?? I would definitely go back for the ice cream but note to the owners: that girls needs to be fired!! There's a bunch of us that walked out there saying "wow, she was rude".
author: Vicki K.

description: I really want to like this place, which is why I'll probably return. That said, I'm really having trouble lately in finding any redeeming qualities in what should be a local gem of a candy shop. I also am sure it's quite difficult to run a small business these days, hence the hefty price on their bulk candy. So here's what I got last time- two very small, sadly wrapped bags of candy and a melted junior cone for $18. $18!!!! There must have been a misunderstanding, because there's no way the candy could be that expensive. I didn't want to bother the poor man working behind the counter because it seems like an exhausting time of year...but, at least they could've given me some better gift wrapping, and maybe a frozen scoop of ice cream. :-(
author: Jenna S.

description:
These two stars are for 1. Being a small business and 2. Sugar is always delicious- it's impossible not to like it. My son worked for weeks to 'earn' a fantastical cherry lollipop that he had in his mind. When we arrived they just had a few sad and sticky Tootsi and Blowpops. I had planned to get something crazy and only had my card. Even though they had no minimum purchase, I felt bad and bought another (very efficiently selected) $12 in mini truffles but it was so hard to accomplish because the bored/mad teenager working today was so bothered at having to help us, she kept mouthing "sorry" over us at her friend who was waiting to visit. I'm sure it's impossible to find people who aren't completely insane criminals for minimum wage but maybe try harder? 

I hate complaining on yelp without first contacting the business directly but they have no info listed and no website. People in cities have literally no reason to go to brick and mortar stores except to have a positive/special/not horrible experience. I can't understand why I would come here, given our experience today. Sad because I just wanted my kid to have a special "candy shop" reward but the people working at Target are way nicer. This was super negative and stressful.
author: Andrea W.

description: I come for the Micthell's Ice Cream, never tried they chocolates/candy, however a lot of the stuff here looks like it has been city here for awhile.
author: Elijah B.

description:
So I love Mitchell's ice cream. I think it's the very best ice cream in existence and I always go to Mitchell's. When I found out Shaw's carried mitchell's ice cream, and I could get my fix without the hour long line, I was excited. But I wondered why the store was empty, when Mitchell's is always packed. The same product, so I thought, why not?
If it seems too good to be true, it is...the ice cream was delivered days ago so it was not nearly as fresh as the one at Mitchell's. It was half melted and had pieces of ice in it, gross! Plus the waffle cone that was also delivered days ago was completely stale. I asked for another but every single one was stale as though it were weeks old. So she had to give me a sugar cone but the ice cream was so melty that it spilled out. Caught some in a cup, but overall nothing like the actual mitchell's. I'd rather stand in line at Mitchell's and get the actual thing, fresh and delicious, to be worth the calories. Shaw's wasn't, and I will not be back.
author: Ilana g.

description:
A sweet oasis right snack in the middle West Portal. It's more than See's - think fabulous fudge, ice cream, and a homey welcoming vibe with extraordinary chocolates. I tend to stock up on treats at Valentine's Day,  Easter and Drop of the Hat...and a Cute little bench outside...
Agreed: pricey.
author: Kae D.

description:
I came here after a meal at Squat and Gobble and came out thoroughly craving each and every candy I saw. It's got a really distinctively classic candy shop vibes. 

I got the Oreo ice cream but also tried some of my friends chestnut praline. Both were delightful. Perfect for a post brunch snack!
author: Allison S.

description: This used to be a MUST STOP for anyone in the West Portal district.  What a treat after stopping at Schwab's or Walgreen's or Wells Fargo.  But now the candy is old, the licorice sticks together, rocky road is a layer of solid chocolate with some large marshmallows on top--you might find a nut or two but it is NOT "Rocky Road".  We threw the last half away.  Then went to Walgreen's & bought a Rocky Road candy bar.  Much better.  Rave reviews online?  Check out the dates--those days are gone. Sad...just sad.
author: Diane G.

description: Coming home from a Warriors game on my birthday and we wanted  milkshakes.  Found on Yelp that we could get them at Shaw's.  Walked up to the door at 9:30 p.m. (store hours "open till 10 p.m.) and it was locked.  We knocked and a teenage girl came to the door and said "she was closing early because she was tired and was cleaning, so sorry".  We thought "what?" How rude.  But thanks to Yelp we went up the street to Calibur and had great service and a great milkshake. (Store hours "open till 10 p.m.").
author: Lynn L.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream (Thin Mint) and a pound of nonpareils.
And, it's 75 degrees today in the city!
Those are three deadly combinations.
Shaw's is fantastic.
author: Thomas D.

description: It's pretty sad to have to write this review, but I can't deny that Shaw's has really lost it's charm. I went in a month and a half ago to browse their selection which is pretty nonexistent at this point. Other than the few candies that seem to be made in house, they have barely any stock on their shelves and what is on the shelves is obviously old. While this sparse selection was alarming I still spoke with a sales representative and placed an order for some 50s decade candies to pick up eventually. He wrote my order on a paper bag and took my name and number, telling me the owner would get back to me soon. I am glad I took a card with me as I did not hear from anyone for two weeks. I then decided to call the number on the card for the owner Marissa Dhillon. It took me to the establishment where a female rep told me the owner was not in and that she would have her call me when she arrived. I called when they opened, waited till 4pm and called again. I was told the owner wasn't in; now this being for my mothers 50th birthday event and something that's time sensitive I insisted that she get in touch with the owner and have her call me. To my surprise I did get a call from the owner about 20min later. At this point, the owner assured me she could fulfill my order and even offered to bag them nicely for me. I agreed and later asked for an example of past bags or a preview of the ones she would prepare for me. She explained she did not have past examples, but said she would send along a picture of the ones she would have for me. I have not heard from her since, the party is in 10 days, and so I decided to let her know that I would handle the bags myself and thanked her for the time and effort she put in so far. No response to that either... For such a quintessential candy shop of SF I was hoping for far better service and professionalism. You can do much better Shaw's.
author: Kiva M.

description:
While the ice cream here is good, if you come here looking for Shaw's creamery ice cream you will be disappointed.

Shaw's (Millbrae) was my family's favorite ice cream joint. We would go there a couple times a month, and always ordered the same thing. The location in Millbrae, which closed down a couple of years ago, used to make their ice cream in the back, and gave huge portions to customers. 

Anyways, my father took my brother, mom and I to this location a couple of months ago to relive our childhood, but sadly it seems like this shop does not sell their own ice cream, and instead sells Mitchell's ice cream at a higher price for smaller scoops. A huge let down in my opinion.

Additionally, customer service here is a bit of a hit or miss. You can either get someone who seems like he/she just wants to go home for the day or someone who is really friendly and attentive.
author: Janelle C.

description: I arrived at 9:56pm and the employee denied the service because she was closing and had washed everything already. The store closes at 10 and I had reminded the employee. To scoop ice cream it takes an ice cream spoon, in my opinion not very hard to wash. That is why I'm giving it a 1 star!!!
author: Shiomara T.

description:
Hey, let's run a historic candy store into the ground by being TOTAL DOUCHES to the children that patronize it! 

Massive fail.  Sell your business, you fool.
author: Nick D.

description:
Four words. Chocolate covered gummi bears.

First time I came here, I was surprised since the place looked like it was from the 1930s. The worker however did state that the place has been around for a good 80 years. Wow.

I love the assortment of candies and goodies you can find in this place. What captivated me was their homemade fudge. They make it in different flavors and they look like bricks on display but they're also strangely inviting. The chocolate turtles are so cute just because they really look like turtles.

They also have ice cream here! I had the pralines and cream, and I really liked how subtle it was. 

The dang gummi bears. For a bag of em, it's $12. A bit pricey, but these little turds are delicious as heck. The chocolate isnt too hard and the gummi bears are easily chewable and dont stick onto your teeth. The chocolate and gummi blend well together and they melt into your mouth like .. naturally LOL. I really like the white chocolate ones though. So nommies.

The worker here might seem like a mean old guy but he is actually really helpful. I love these old mom&pop shops because they know exactly what they're serving up. 

Kudos to you Shaw, I'll be back again :).
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I always make a special trip to West Portal just to buy The white turtle chocolate snack which is " delicious !!"
Also, I have tasted the oreo cookie ice cream cone. It is another flavor to savory and to die for if you are a oreo cookie lover !!
author: Gloria C.

description: Stopped by on a Saturday night 30 minutes before closing and the clerk said no, she was tired, and was closing early to clean.
author: Janet L.

description: Came here to pick up some gummy sodas for my boss. It's very clean and well  organized but a little on the pricey side but it's to be expected with these gourmet candy shops nowadays.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Got total of 2 scoops of Mitchell's ice cream; 1 scoop of grasshopper pie and 1 scoop of pistachio 

Grasshopper pie was delicious! It was similar to a combination of mint chip Oreo ice cream

White pistachio was very yummy as well. 

We also got 1 pound of chocolate and white chocolate gummy bears ! This was really expensive... $12 !! I was thinking about 6$ tops !! So hesitant on buying because it was so expensive

Would I come back? Yes if I'm in the area ! I think there are other cheaper places n just as yummy as well!
author: Alicia N.

description:
**THIS IS NOT A CHILD FRIENDLY ESTABLISHMENT!!!**
I never thought that a candy store visit would result in a traumatic event for my children and I.  At 6:30 pm last night, I took my two boys for an after dinner treat.  As curious children go, my son pulled open the lever on a jelly bean dispenser before I could place a bag underneath.  The woman behind the counter (apparently the owner) began yelling, "Do not touch that again!!" I explained that it was an accident and asked her to please calm down.  While on the floor cleaning up the small handful of jelly beans she continued to yell, "those are all garbage now and we are not going to be able to sell them!"  My 2 year old son began to scream at this point, clinging to me and grabbing at my hair.  My 2 year old is on the autism spectrum and became very dysregulated as a result of this woman's rage.  While on the ground with now two distressed children (my 5 year old also in tears), I locked eyes with her and asked her to "calm herself because it's not a big deal."  When she continued to have words with me, I stated, "You can obviously see I'm struggling." 
I quickly poured some jelly beans in a bag and turned to the counter.  Prepared to make reparations, I pulled out a $20 bill, handed it to her stating, "go ahead and charge me an extra $5 or $10 dollars for the spillage."  It was less than 50 cents worth of jelly beans.  I was prepared to give her $20 and call it.  She then told me she wasn't going to sell me anything and to get out of her store.  She threatened to contact the police and grabbed the phone. I tossed the jellies on the counter...a small plastic spoon tipped over ( I think) and we left.  To be fair, I called her a name on the way out. 
I got my boys safely in the car.  It took a while to get my 2 year old calm.  This was supposed to be fun.  My 5 year old felt awful for spilling jelly beans.  I assured him he did nothing wrong (that he is a child and still learning).  I pulled around to the front of the store and waited a few minutes for the police to show in order to explain what really happened (and to reassure my children).  We left after a few minutes. 

This afternoon, I contacted Shaw's and asked to speak to the owner.  The woman from the previous night identified herself as the owner.  I stated who I was and attempted to explain.  She immediately started yelling again, threatening me and stated that the police were "looking for me".  She hung up in a rage.  
I contacted Taraval station and spoke with one of the officers on duty.  He provided me with the CAN number as well as the names of the officers that came out.   I explained the situation in detail.  The officer explained that a report wasn't even made and that the owner was making "idle threats".  He did say that police responded to the call (as obligated), stayed a few minutes and wrote one simple note, "verbal dispute". The officer was kind and apologetic for the way my children and I were treated.  I offered to give him my name and number but he didn't feel this was necessary. 
As a member of several parent groups and Autism Speaks, I plan to inform all parents that Shaw's is not child friendly.  Nobody deserves this kind of treatment.  There are too many wonderful, accepting businesses in the bay area to ever have to step foot in this sad establishment.

A side note** If you scroll through most bad reviews, the primary complains are regarding the terrible service and most parents seem to echo what I've said.  Apparently, I am not the only one whose been traumatized and treated poorly over jelly beans.  I feel bad for Mr. Shaw.  I am sure this was not his vision.
author: Jenny N.

description: Simple old fashion sweet shop.  You know what you are going to get.  The kids love the ice cream and candy and the staff that work there are very friendly and patient.
author: Erich B.

description:
This is a solid place, sort of a nostalgic throwback to the days of yore where kids went to the local corner store to buy candies.

They sell assorted candies by the pound, and have a nice selection and friendly staff.

It's a nice place to take your young kids and experience the retail sugar rush.

Parking in front is more difficult to find, and it's metered, but there's a parking lot (metered to pay) on the same side of the street and parallel as well as perpendicular there's plenty of free street parking if you're willing to walk a block or few blocks or so in the surrounding residential neighborhood.
author: Rick S.

description:
I grew up in West Portal - seen the changes at Shaws over the years...not thrilled.  Tonight I ordered a "small jawbreaker" for my son.  Price?  $4.95.  For one small jawbreaker.  The lady apologized, saying she doesn't make the prices...

Are u kidding me??!!
author: Mary H.

description: Very disappointed with the Christmas chocolates I bought in Shaws a couple of days ago. I wanted individually wrapped premium chocolates for my advent calendar. I got 3 bags of chocolates, wrapped in cellophane with a cute red ribbon on top. Unfortunately, upon opening and eating the chocolates I was found it to be very low quality- the kind of chocolates you pick up at the dollar store that are waxy and sugary but with little real chocolate. My 10 and 13 year old won't even eat the chocolates saying Hershey's and Nestles taste way better than these.  Such a disappointment.  I would have expected Shaw's to use better quality chocolates since they're a specialty candy shop in an upscale neighborhood.
author: Clara B.

description: Best Ice Cream and Candy Shop in San Francisco! This continues to be an extraordinary, old school establishment. They have an exceptional array of ice cream flavors. My favorite is thin mint and grasshopper. The vanilla, chocolate and strawberry can't be beat! In addition to delicious ice cream, they have a vast array of chocolate candies and some of my favorites including chocolate bridge mix, malt balls, Swedish fish, gummies and jelly bellies! Owner, Marissa and her husband are wonderful, as are the super friendly staff! Great for kids and adults alike!
author: William H.

description:
On 4/30 approximately 2:40pm (that precise so you guys can check the schedule and aware the lady working that shift.) my girlfriend got rudely yelled at by the lady working. 

"Please do not go back there?"
With a tone that will haunt her forever. It ended with a question statement and the attitude was beyond rude. 

Miss, if you are reading this, if you had a bad day, don't take it out on your customers. Especially when it's our very first visit. We weren't loud or obnoxious, just got out of a beautiful stroll around the neighborhood. We walked in didn't get greeted, but the only thing was 
"Please do not go back there?"

There was no signs, and she was confused. She was just overwhelmed by what she saw. I would've been understanding if we were being loud and rude, however we are not that type of customers. 

Your warm not-welcoming attitude just lost a potential future regulars, and I hope you won't do that to any other people again. 

"Please do not go back there?"

It still echoes through our mind... With fear.
author: Joey K.

description: Fabulous ice cream! We had fun looking at the chocolates too- but didn't end up enjoying what we picked. Luck if the draw-- I will go back and try more options. Great place to take the kids. No seating area-- except one bench-- wished they had that so it was easier to stop and finish the ice cream.
author: Monica T.

description: Yum! Chocolate! Who doesn't love chocolate, or candy for that matter. One of the more delicious treats I received for Mother's Day was a bunch of bags of candy and fudge from shaw's. They were so delicious. I have visited this establishment in the past and have had nothing but good experiences. The customer service is superb. They have the sweetest girls working there. Heck, I'd be happy too if I worked in this fun shop surrounded by devious treats. They also serve Mitchell's ice cream! YUM!
author: Mrs. S.

description: Great fudge and divinity. Friendly service. A happy experience. Parking in the area is abysmal, however. But worth some patience.
author: R H.

description:
Sometimes it really feels like you're living out an episode of "Leave It to Beaver" when you stroll through West Portal. You can probably have a complete retro-50's dining experience by eating at Manor Coffee Shop and then getting some ice cream at Shaw's where you're likely to see Wally and Eddie hanging out when Mrs. Cleaver suddenly walks in with the Beaver... Eddie: "Wally, if your dumb brother tags along, I'm gonna - oh, good afternoon, Mrs. Cleaver. I was just telling Wallace how pleasant it would be for Theodore to accompany us to the movies."

Shaw's actually takes me back to my childhood in San Mateo where it was a big treat to go Shaw's on El Camino Real for their ice cream. I think the candy-strip awning is still the same, but the chain was sold years ago. This may be the last one left, and whoever owns the place is smart enough to serve Mitchell's ice cream. Jamie W. and I walked in on a Saturday afternoon, thrilled that it was open since it closes its door at 6PM. I went with a small $3.50 cup of Pineapple Coconut (see photo) and promptly sat down on the solitary bench in front. Chocolate turtles - their signature confection - were in sparse numbers in the display case. Bummer.

ICE CREAM - 4 stars...it's Mitchell's, no-brainer
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...retro vibe in the Wayback Machine
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...chipper
TOTAL - 4 stars..."That's a lovely string of pearls, Mrs. Cleaver."
author: Ed U.

description:
My friend and I were craving ice cream so we decided to stop by this place because we happened to walk by.

I've passed by this place many times. It's not too hard to miss because of the stripey banner. A friend told me once that they had really good ice cream so I told myself I would try it sometime.

Walking in, I already thought the place was cute in a cozy, local kind of way. It's small but has a nice variety of house-made treats as well we sweets from other manufacturers (like Pez and jelly belly). 

The ice cream was in the back. I was under the impression that they made their own ice cream but it's actually Mitchell's brand. In a way, I was slightly disappointed but I wasn't upset. Mitchell's is always good. 

I chose to get white pistachio and my friend got chocolate caramel crackle. Both were great. My was very pistachio-y and my friend's was very chocolate-y. 

Overall, adorable place. I'd stop by again if I was in the area.
author: Sofia R.

description: The people working in this place are super rude.  I don't tolerate that kind of BS.  Give someone else your money.
author: Jesus H.

description:
This place makes me want to have kids. It's super cute and old timey. 
The ice cream is Mitchell's, so you know it's good. I also really appreciate their selection of sugar free candy.  The staff, maybe they are the owners, are always really nice.
author: Corey Jace W.

description: My kids and I while in he area stopped by here. It was our first time and we really enjoyed it. We came here on a Thursday evening around six. The girl behind the counter was extremely nice and welcomed us in as we walked thru the door. This place is full of sweet deliciousness I had to control myself from buying all the goodies. We also ordered ice cream (Mitchell's) can't go wrong.  Overall I think it's a nice little spot and a great location.
author: Lila N.

description: I don't eat sugar, so maybe this place wasn't for me. But, the stuff seemed kind of old and sad. If you want Mitchells ice cream, wouldn't you go to Mitchells?
author: Andrew K.

description:
A fantastic little candy store, it's a slice of heaven in West Portal. They have pretty much any candy you can think of. The ice cream is delicious, I had the green tea ice cream (awesome!) and my husband really liked the chocolate. 

They don't have sugar-free ice cream, which doesn't matter to me, but someone had come in when we were there requesting it. So just a heads-up for those with dietary needs.

Also, the blonde cashier who helped us was super friendly, she should get a raise. ;)
author: Shannon O.

description:
Old time candy shop located in West Portal.  Floors are still linoleum.  Here you can find fudge, chocolates, hard candies, gummies, and Mitchell's ice cream.

My favorites include the huge chocolate covered malt balls and the dark chocolate honeycomb candies.  $8.99 lb and you can mix and match the chocolates.

Metered parking.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Have definitely passed by this place a couple of time and ice cream is something I've always loved and craved after dinner. 

We had some dinner and ended up parking close to this shop. Because we had such a full dinner, I just wanted to get a small kid's size scoop of cookies and cream, but the date obviously wanted something a lot more and ended up getting a waffle cone with 2 scoops of pralines and cream...and then didn't finish it. 

Overall, they have Mitchell's ice cream which definitely makes me super happy...and I just saw in another review that they have shaved ice? This makes me super happy.
author: Nina Y.

description: Shaw's will always hold a special place in my heart since its officially "That neighborhood candy icecream shop I used to visit growing up." My favorite thing growing up was their chocolate covered gummy bears, but now that I'm a little older I find them just a tad too sweet for me. I now indulge in their various types of fudges and that occasional coke bottle gummy, and DEFINITELY their icecream =)
author: Eleana H.

description: This place reminds me of the old candy shops back in the day. It's charming and I love how they sell ice cream. I bought chocolate covered gummy bears for my brother & there was both white & milk chocolate. It was a bit pricey but I would still highly recommend this place in support of the good old mom & pop shops. They've been around for years. They also make their own fudge! I will definitely be back!!!
author: Brittany D.

description: I grew up in the neighborhood often coming here for afternoon treats. Tonight we tried to run in there right before 10. The young man said yes you may come in for one last scoop of ice cream and opened the door for us. Then a blonde curly haired girl walked out and said no even though it's before 10 it will probably be 10 by the time I finish ringing you up and refuses to serve us. The young male felt very bad but it was terrible service from her and I am going to think twice about going in there especially if she is working.
author: Sara B.

description: Good ice cream. BUT THE WORST SERVICE EVER!!! I was there on 5/27/16 from 2pm-3:30pm and the young girl working there was incredibly rude to my two year old for spilling no more than 10-15 jellybeans. She yelled at her as if she was some military Sargent. I'd already gone and told her to stop doing that and grabbed her by the hand and brought her closer to me by the line away from the jellybeans. She started to cry because she was so scared and there was a big group of people in there. I understand that it's her job to check the customers if they are doing something wrong (which I know my daughter shouldn't have done that) but did she really have to yell "COULD YOU STOP?? JUST STOP! STOP!" to a 2 year old?? And then roll her eyes at her and torn around with the biggest sigh as she was having an asthma attack. Then, when she finally took my i e cream order she said "you know what mam, I talk to all the kids and adults the same way". Really??? How the hell is she still working there. It's an ice cream shop where kids go and maybe she should go work at a library. I told her that it wasn't the first time she was rude to us and her response was "that's not true. I've never seen you before". Then continued to roll her eyes and sigh some more. I called today and talked to the manager and it really didn't sound like she gave a crap. She sounded like she was trying to just rush the convo and end the call. She did offer is free cones for our next visit but after going there for over 4 years and my husband since he was a teenager we will not be going there again. Hopefully the girl with the sigh problem does get some kind of punishment.
author: Liliana S.

description: They have Mitchell's ice cream and tons of candies and chocolate sweets.  A nice stop over after lunch or dinner to satisfy your sweet tooth.  There was only one person manning the store so there may be a wait.
author: Pam Y.

description:
Even if my pants are bursting at the seams, I always have to have something sweet after dinner (or breakfast or lunch) My fiance has regularly indulged me here where we've gotten a little slice of fudge to share or a scoop of Mitchell's Ice Cream. You definitely feel like you're stepping back in time -- displays of truffles & gummies & fudge! They also have Hawaiian Shaved Ice which I can't wait to try when it's not November.

The staff is super friendly & let you try as many ice cream flavors as you want (and I would know) I also love that they have some super exotic flavors in addition to stand by favorites -- pumpkin, purple yam, grasshopper pie. We will be back -- again & again!
author: Chantelle D.

description:
When you have a weird ice cream flavor, but it's the best one you have every had, you know you are at the right place. Ube, purple yam, is one of those flavored at my favorite candy store, shaws. 

Ube is a classic flavor at shaws. The candy shop now has anything you could want. I suggest not going there from 2:30 - 3:30 because all the students after school go there. My personal favorite ice cream is the ube and the grasshopper pie. They give many different sizes of cones and they just came out with a mini mini cone which is great for kids. 

Shaws has now brought cotton candy, kettle corn, and a frozen drink makers into their store. I've only had the cotton candy which was delicious, but not as well formed as the ones you buy at the store or zoo. I've heard great things about the kettle corn, but I've never seen someone get a frozen drink. If you ever get cotton candy, I highly suggest the piña colada flavor.

The candy that they sell is old and new. They have my personal favorite throwback candy, Razzles, and the more modern candies like Reece's. They also have candy cigarettes and gum cigarettes. The candy cigarettes aren't that good, but the gym cigarettes are delicious. They have many flavor of jelly beans and many different pez heads. They also have action figures, lunch boxes, and pillows that have something to do with candy. They have many different fudge flavors such as rocky road and cookies and cream. They will name one fudge the "Fudge of the Month". I've personally never seen someone buy fudge, but the pieces get smaller and smaller each time I go. 

Over all, this candy shop is great for people of all ages and a great desert place if you go to a restaurant near by.
author: Doon B.

description:
Shaw's is that dessert parlor with an old fashioned feel to it that everyone loves. The candy store and ice cream shop is perfect for kids (or even adults) on the lucky days when sunshine warms up the West Portal neighborhood. One of my favorite local stores along West Portal. The store features tons of candies, fudges, and all sorts of other sweets that are great gift ideas or just desserts for you to satisfy your sweet tooth. Prices are reasonable and the staff here is super friendly. 

One of the best things about this place is the fact that they sell Mitchell's Ice Cream! Given how ridiculous the lines are at the Mitchell's main location near Bernal Heights, Shaw's offers a great variety of flavors, many of which you'd find at the factory location but literally without the long wait you usually find at Mitchell's. All the flavors are delicious and the regular sized scoop of ice cream is a generous portion for $3.50. 

While I'll miss the good ol' days when Shaw's sold a range of fruit flavored slushies back in the day, the store still brings back memories for everyone whether you've got a kid or still a kid at heart yourself. Good old fashion candy store with all sorts of desserts to satisfy that sweet tooth of yours.
author: Cheston W.

description: Three stars for a place I WANT to give five stars to. I grew up with Shaws and it is my neighborhood store and I WANT to be a loyal customer- but it's just not great. Sure they carry great ice cream but it is always stored improperly and has ice chips in it and tastes very stale. I am pickier than most, and other people love it, but if you really like your ice cream sand ice chips...
author: Jo J.

description: I come to this place quite often after school to get some ice cream and jelly beans. They give pretty generous ice cream scoops...though it depends on the person working there. Remember to sample the flavors before buying!
author: Anna H.

description: This is the kind of place that makes me annoyed that there is no way to write a no-star review.  I have never visited a less child-friendly, supposedly child-centered place.  Candy shops are supposed to be fun, right?  What is the absolute opposite of fun??  That's this candy shop.  It makes a mockery of candy shops.  First of all, the candy is unappetizing.  I could tolerate that if the place weren't so unwelcoming to children.  The proprietor watched my kids like they were animals who were preying on her precious candy.  I don't know if she felt they were going to steal something or make a mess, but her evil eye was making me anxious.  She then yelled at one of my kids when he accidentally spilled a few pieces of candy on the ground.  She is clearly more interested in the cost of her candy than serving the children the store was originally opened to serve.  Lady, please do the children of SF a favor and sell this place to someone who likes kids! My kids left the store scared of her.  I will never walk into this store again.  Pathetic.
author: Marilyn C.

description: We are renting a house nearby and come almost daily. The fudge is really excellent. There are different flavors. Our favorite is vanilla followed by maple nut. There is a vintage feel to the place which is nice also.
author: Joanna B.

description:
Old school candy joint.... some in bins; some in the case (truffles, fudge, chocolates, and bark). 

Prices = moderate to high. 

They also have Mitchell's ice cream here.  (About 10-15 flavors; cone or cup.) 

They have beautiful wrapping for their boxes of chocolate. 

It's a good gift place...I've mostly frequented this place for their boxes of chocolates for gift-giving. lol 

I do love their bench outside though...:) And it's under the awning.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I'm going to start off by saying I'm a bit of a chocolate snob. No Hersey's for me.

This place has the good sh*t. I haven't been here...yet =) My hubby was given a large box of assorted truffles. And of course being the nice wife that I am and helping him enjoy them. I think they are better than See's. 

Good thing they aren't in my neighborhood otherwise it would be bad.
author: Amber S.

description:
think it's lame they won't let you sample the fudge. the malt balls are amazing.  

it's a candy shop... it's good.
author: Emma M.

description:
This old school candy store sells taffy, chocolate covered things (haystacks, turtles, almond bark), truffles, malt balls, Jelly Bellies, gummi candies, Pez dispensers, and giant jawbreakers.  You can get Mitchell's ice cream here by the scoop, pint or quart (they have a case full).  

The only thing they make is the about a dozen types of fudge including divinity (I didn't try any).  

Prices aren't displayed and they're higher than I expected.  I'm still trying to figure out how I spent $30 on candy.  I bought some small chocolate Easter bunnies, malt balls, honeycomb and sour gummi cherries.

* Milk chocolate and dark chocolate honeycomb: both are wonderful; a thick creamy layer of chocolate surrounds a crispy, light, golden center (think Crunchie and Violet Crumble)
* Mint chocolate malt balls: mmm, so good, these are also creamy with a slight crunch
* Sour gummi cherries: The cherries are the best, no wonder they're sold separately now

The cases aren't brimming with candy - sections are empty.  There isn't much non-candy merchandise: a few stuffed animals and lunch boxes.
author: Lolia S.

description:
tried a few ice cream flavor here.  My favorite is the pineapple and coconut.
there are lots of pineapple chunks.
rum raisin and Kahlua cream were decent.
author: Rina C.

description: Not just an ice cream shop, but candy and fuse to boot. And I mean a lot of it. This place is a great spot for the neighborhood, and not just because it keeps our local dentists grinding away. It's great when you have a spot like this where the community can go. I'd rather go to a small shop and see neighbors than Walgreens and grab a hat of discontent candies. Small sweet shops like this get the kids out of the tv room and in the neighborhood.
author: Ben L.

description: Shaw's has really nice, friendly staff that serve Mitchell's ice cream and some of the best testing fudge I've ever eaten. Great place to visit for an after dinner sweet if you are eating somewhere in the WP...Warning: the ice cream scoops are VERY generous!
author: James P.

description: This cute little candy shop makes me want to bring all my girlfriends here! I love that they sell Mitchell's ice cream. Their homemade fudge is delicious too!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Darn.  I liked this place last year when I discovered it.  The employees were cheerful and helpful with a firm grasp of English.... and I had a soft spot for the fudge.

But something's changed for the worse.  I'm wondering if the business changed hands?  There is now an older fellow who doesn't seem to speak English, and a crotchety middle-age Asian woman - the last (and final) time I came in a customer was asking for fudge by the fraction of a pound and he was cut off by her gesturing "show me - this much okay?"...she didn't seem to know how to use the scale?!  

The customer experience has turned tacky....boo!
author: Femita J.

description:
My little neighborhood candy shop!

Shaw's has been around since 1931...and still growing strong in the West Portal neighborhood.  

Before walking in, it's not hard to notice the cute festive decorations displayed in the front window.  Shaw's always does an awesome job decorating for practically every holiday.  Cute pumpkin and turkey figurines are aligned throughout.  

Since Shaw's is an old establishment, you definitely won't get the "modern" candy shop feel that exist throughout SF today ,but its the great simplicity that makes Shaw's so unique.  You really do feel like you are wondering the streets of an old town Main Street during the turn of the century. 

For goodies, they have a nice little display of chocolate fudge, a Jelly Belly jelly bean wall, a window for sour candies and chocolates, and behind the cashier area, is the gumball display.  

They also sell Mitchell's ice cream here as well, with the junior scope starting at $2.50.  

This afternoon, during my leisurely stroll of my neighborhood, I was craving some sweets, so I decided on an old time favorite from my childhood...Chocolate Covered Gummy Bears.  I was actually very surprised to find that they have them covered in both Milk Chocolate and White Chocolate too.  So I bought a handful mixed with both milk and white chocolate. Total came out to about $3.50.  Not bad.  

Shaw's is an adorable, simple neighborhood candy shop.  And they always decorate so beautifully during all holidays.
author: Cass J.

description:
Although it's not my fave place to go for candy, I will admit that it's cute and I love seeing little kids so amazed, hence "like a kid in a candy store." Definitely brings back memories of when I was younger. 

The prices have seemed to go up over the  years. I think I've seen a small bag of gumballs for like $10 or maybe even more. I'm not a big fan of their chocolate, but I do love the fact that they carry Mitchell's! I also love the old-school vibe of the place. 

As far as satisfying my candy needs, I'd rather go to Walgreens. It's easier on the pockets.
author: Fallon P.

description:
A mom and pop candy store right on the corner... okay maybe more like the middle.

Shaw's is one of those rare candy stores I actually like. The store's floor plan is well thought out and they're clean and extremely cute. They even have a licorice box, which boasts 5-7 different kinds of licorice and their ice cream is also quite tasty, if not a staining issue.

The only negative I could see is that they don't have price per pound on their boxes.

Other than that I lurves this place.
author: Meg T.

description:
Ok, so maybe I'm biased because I haven't found a candy shop that I don't like!  They have the basic fudge, chocolates, gummies, candy you'd expect...and then they also have Mitchell's ice cream.  Yes!  Mitchells where I can easily find parking and I don't have to deal with a huge line?!?!  Yes!  Sure, they don't have as big of a selection as the real Mitchell's, but they still had Mexican Chocolate so I don't care about anything else.

My only complaint?  Why are you not open late at night so I can fulfill my ice cream and candy cravings?!?!
author: Quynh-An P.

description: I love it! Has a nice great home feel to it! The ice cream is great, the people are friendly, and there's so much selection of candy! I recommend the chocolate covered blueberries !!!
author: Gabriela C.

description: They have Mitchell's ice cream (excellent) and decent candy (good). It's a cool little store in West Portal. Kids absolutely love this sugar shrine.
author: Michael S.

description: Pastels, Scotty Dogs, Cinnamon Bears... oh my!  They've added slushies, cotton candy and multi flavored kettle corn in the last 6 months.  Fudge is made on site... fudge of the week. Fantastic assortment of hard and soft candies... suger free... Mitchell's ice cream too.  I love the retro pez and other sundries.  Most of the time the owners are working and it shows that they care.  When you need to go for a treat, treat yourself to Shaw's!
author: Sam L.

description:
Our friend Nika brings us a delicious assortment of Shaws dark chocolates each time she drives down from the city. What a treat! Malt Balls are especially yummy.

We now want to visit the store next time we visit SF.
author: Jackie S.

description: I used to go here when I went to St Stephens! They haven't changed a thing which why this place is soo awesome! Love this place!
author: Kyle W.

description:
When my Mom was a kid, she would come here and get goodies for my Grandma.
What's different, is that now I go with her.

There's homemade fudge in many flavors for my Dad, jelly bellies for my picky niece, truffles for my Grandma, chocolate covered walnuts for my Mom and bridge mix for me. I love a good bridge mix, such a caliedescope of different textures and chewies and crunchies and super sweet and slightly tart. Theirs is unlike any other, with a rare mint sometimes, followed by a whole walnut or almond, dried fruit or covered caramel. Yum.

Shaw's is tiny, but has breadth. You will find something you want, something you didn't -but now must have and something you had no idea existed, and will now, too, be in your little paper bag as you waltz out the door.
author: Katie W.

description: the best white choco gummy bears i have ever had.  I love this shop, i have to take off haft a day just to get to the shop for the white choco gummy bears.  Give it a try, you will love it
author: Ann A.

description: Great old time shop. i like that they serve Mitchells Ice Cream. I wish they would keep the candy contained it gets a little stale.
author: Audra H.

description:
I make it a point to frequent small businesses as much as humanly possible and I'm so glad that I discovered Shaw's.  The kidlets and I love to come in and grab some candy and a scoop of Mitchell's ice cream.  The owner is super nice and is so patient with my kids who are always so excited to come and visit--you know how kids are in a candy shop :-)

Shaw's is small, cozy, and definitely old school--what's not to love about it?
author: Kathy H.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

On those hot days, the MITCHELLS ice cream (so good!) is perfect! Having the rocky road ice cream on a sugar cone was so yummy! And the sour candy area?! Yum x100! Go here if you haven't already, and if you have been here, GO AGAIN!
author: Kelly M.

description:
mmm! I just came back from a wonderful cup of ice cream :) Walking into this candy store really makes me feel like I just walked into once of those candy stores during Willy Wanka's era. The ice cream hear is terrific! Super thick and delicious, delightfully subtle and not sickeningly sweet. Definitely some high quality stuff.

I would recommend the Black Walnut and Chocolate ice cream!
author: Grace O.

description: This place is a regular weekly spot for my son and myself.  We can't go too close or else he needs to go in.  The ice cream is fantastic - Mitchell's and the candy looks amazing.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Great priced ice cream with soooo many great flavors!!! They used to give large cups...now they reduced it by half. Awww. The store is ultra cute with an assortment of candies you can treat yourself with or get a gift for.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description:
Its May...

Its 88 degrees in SF in May... 

and Im freaking sick. 

WTH.

Well, I guess that gives me an excuse to indulge in some ice cream goodness!!! Muahahhaha. There's always a silver lining. ;)

I tried white pistachio and thin mint and .......It didn't TASTE LIKE ANYTHING!! It tasted cold and creamy... if you could taste cold and creamy. My stuffy nose and sore throat had killed my tastebuds. DAMN YOU COLD!!!

Anywho, I just went with a junior scoop of Ube on a sugar cone since thats my usual Mitchells flavor and I knew my tummy would enjoy it even if my mouth and brain couldn't.  Well, it wasn't a junior scoop. It was more of a blob. A glob of Ube flubber if you will. The old lady that came in looked at my ice cream and said "ooo.. thats pretty." Im sure she was talking about the gorgeously bright purple hue and not the scoop itself.

I licked and nibbled my way down to the sugar cone. It had a white wrapper on the outside so I started tearing it like foil on a burrito. I get down to the tip and find GLUE DIRECTLY ON MY CONE!!! GROSS!!! The whole wrapper was glued onto the cone on the bottom!!! I know I can't taste anything and probably wouldn't be able to taste glue on my cone.. thinking only that that one bite was a little chewier than others, but I'm sure little kids wouldn't have noticed and would have gobbled it right up. Tell me it was edible non-toxic glue?? UNACCEPTABLE!!!
author: Angela W.

description: Mitchell's ice cream. :-) Super friendly and funny owners. Really fun pez dispensers. Not really any place to sit but there's a bench outside. Clean and sparkly.
author: J P.

description: They serve Mitchell's ice cream - need I  say more?  Oreo Cookie and  Strawberries and cream.  Yummm...  Old fashioned candy shop.  Cute.  A candy lovers paradise.
author: Denise M.

description: A unique gem located in w portal. Came here after dinner for some ice cream. This place is nice and puts you in a jolly holiday mood. There was a sweet, pretty girl that was helpful. Overall a decent place for a quick dessert or sweet fix.
author: Dave N.

description:
2.5 stars rounded up.

Tax Day. I needed something to sweeten up my day. I walked into Shaw's hoping to find exciting, unique candies & found none. Sure they have gummy worms & some salt water taffy (the old stand bys) but nothing too "boutique-y." 

I settled for chocolate (yes, I prefer candy over chocolate.) Eyeing my options (fudge, gorgeous truffles, Mitchell's ice cream, etc) I picked three filled milk chocolates: maple, lemon & strawberry. Not too impressive, similar to the chocolates you find in a generic Valentine's Day heart shaped box from the drug store. At least the price was right ($2 for my three pieces. Their chocolates are $15.95/lb.)

Shaw's is old school. Nothing is shiny or new, nothing is colorful, nothing is lively. I'm sure Shaw's has a special place in the hearts of people who grew up eating their sweets, but it did nothing to tug at my heart strings. 

The Filipino couples running the store were extremely personable. They brightened up my day more than their chocolates did.
author: Fancypants X.

description: I've been coming here ever since I went to elementary school. It truly is one of the best candy shop! When you walk in, it's like a dream come true when you were little! Candy on shelves, and to pick from! Ice cream, and home made fudge! MMM!
author: Lianne D.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped by here for dessert after dinner. It's such a cute shop with tons of sweets. The decor and layout is reminiscent of an old school ice cream parlor with soda jerks. No jerks here, though. The girl who helped us was very friendly. We got a couple scoops of ice cream and some truffles for later. Will be back!
author: Ana I.

description: No line for Mitchell's ice cream? Hashtag winning.
author: Erika W.

description: The final stop on our West Portal Mothers Day adventure.  Could not resist stopping for a sweet treat to cap our day.  Shaws ice cream fit the bill nicely.  The linoleum floors, friendly staff, candy assortment and great selection of ice cream made this a no brainer.  Our selected options included mint, chocolate and peanut butter indulgence.  All rich in flavor, smooth and creamy.  You can sample before buying and they offer milkshakes, fudge and a wide array of candies.  A perfect fit for this neighborhood and a great cap to the day.
author: Jaci G.

description:
This was my after school hang out!
We'd walk down to West Portal and get Slush Puppies!

This shop is a true gem in the neighborhood! 
Yummy smooth, creamy, velvet fudge!
author: Erika G.

description:
Really?  Yelp reviewers gave this place four and five stars?  Why?  

I walked into this place WANTING to like it.  It's a mom and pop shop in a great neighborhood.  Yet before I even set foot into the place my sister said, "Yeah, no.  We're not gonna like this place."  Why?  Because through the door we could see this store gave the impression it was dingy and old.  

This was perhaps the first candy store I had been in that I found unappealing.  Perhaps it was due to the florescent lighting or the dingy old floors or the walls in dire need of paint.  Or the candy that was displayed unattractively that just made you NOT want to purchase candy.

Okay, yes.  They had Mitchell's ice cream.  One star there.  And they sold lunch boxes with various candy logos.  Another star there.  But aside from that, nothing special to recommend this place.

I would really encourage the management to revamp this place.  It should be a lot better than it actually is.
author: Gordon A.

description: Been coming here since I was a little kid. Loved to get slushes during the summer. Also excellent ice cream. And don't forget candy, chocolates, fudge...like an old fashioned candy store.
author: Maria M.

description:
I'm always passing by here as I walk through West Portal nearly every weekday.  I've been in a handful of times for either a piece of chocolate or some ice cream (which, as many others have noted, is from Mitchell's).

The store is clean, the proprietors are kind, and the Mitchell's Ice Cream is incredible (except for the Chocolate Caramel Crackle... had an odd hint of something that didn't seem to go well alongside the caramel and chocolate... cardamom maybe?).

From the times I've gotten candy or chocolate here, I don't remember it being out of this world, but if you absolutely need your fix, Shaws will fit the bill.

I'm a fan.
author: Trevor H.

description:
Cute candy store and the PEZ display at the window helps lure in those intrigued by nostalgia.  What draws you in are the rows of chocolate fudges and truffles. In the back there's an good favorite assortment of Mitchell's Ice Cream for those who can't make the MIC run.  

What really hits my 80's heart are the tin boxes lining the wall...I remember the days when I had my Star Wars tin lunch box in hand swinging away. You kids don't know what you're missing when you bang the crap out of your lunch box or the ping of the latch as you smash your uneaten sandwich squished underneath the thermos on the side. HAHAA...to this day I always have a soft touch for lunch boxes.

Service is very friendly and parking is kinda okay...it's always you vs the world when it comes to parking.
author: Pauline L.

description:
On a cold day in December, I was window shopping in the West Portal area.  I find a store with red and white pinstripe in their awning and thought how festive.  Little did I know then that I walked into Shaw's of San Francisco, a candy store institution that has been around since the 1930's.

This place does take me back into time.  There are chocolates, jelly beans, and fudge.  Also, there are candies sold from long ago like Abba Zabba, Sugar Daddy and Pez.  Wait, Pez is still around!  But what grabs my eye was in the back of the store . . .

They sell Mitchell's Ice Cream!!  And they have holiday flavors too.

So I go in and have a scoop of Peppermint ice cream and a scoop of Butterscotch Marble ice cream.  The Peppermint has sweet chunks of red and pink peppermint swirled in vanilla while the butterscotch also swirled in vanilla was a nice smooth flavor that was dreamy.

If you are looking for great candy gift items, this is the spot!  It's great feeling like a kid again when I go to Shaw's.
author: Janet H.

description: Best Place to buy PEZ Dispensers and M&M Dispensers in San Francisco
author: Ted K.

description: great little local candy shop. fun & friendly workers and great selection. We stop by regularly for a sweet tooth fix.
author: Daniel S.
Katy A.

description:
Shaw's was a staple for my wife growing up, as she went to elementary school just up the street at West Portal, and would look forward to walking to Shaw's after school and buying a few pieces of candy.  My wife took me to Shaw's one day while we were visiting my in-laws, and I can see why there are so many favorable reviews about this local candy shop.  

Popular, fun boxed candies (think Lemonheads, etc.) are for sale in addition to purchasing candies & chocolates by the 1/4 pound.  We picked up some chocolate covered gummie bears, as well as some sour chewies.  They have an extensive chocolate collection (bridge mix, chocolate-covered-everything-you-want, etc.) so if you're in the mood for something sweet, stop by Shaw's and treat yourself to a variety of candies.  Last we visited, they had ice-cream for sale by the cone towards the back, which tops off any sweet tooth's desire.  

The minus one star is for the limited and hectic parking in the West Portal area.  I had to drop my wife off at the store while I circled around a few times just to find a spot.
author: Andy P.

description:
I have a soft spot for Shaw's... I went to school at West Portal Lutheran and would often come with my friends  after school or our teachers would take us after field trips. I was sad to learn that they stopped making slushy (they made 7-11 slurpees look and taste like crap) as that was what we got most of the time we came. They now have Mitchells Ice Cream which is great as I love close to Shaw's but far from the actual Mitchells Ice Cream store. The only bad thing is that a lot of their candy is over priced... I think many of it you can find at the corner store or even Walgreens for a lot cheaper HOWEVER I will say you must get their chocolate covered gummy bears as you can't find them at most places but beware it's about $11 a pound but sooooooo worth it. Oh and don't even think about buying the giant Pez dispensers as my boyfriend and I saw a Barbie one at Ross for $14. The staff here are always friendly and helpful. Just in case you've been wondering how long I've been going to Shaw's... I graduated from 8th grade in 1997. You do the math.
P.S. I was sad to learn that the Shaw's in Millbrae closed!
author: selina n.

description:
Food: Sweet! Had a Jr scoop of chocolate chip and it hit the spot. Theres also a nice selection of candy including jelly bellys, fudge, and packaged candy.

Service: Very friendly

Atmosphere: An old school candy/ice cream store but plenty of room to browse around

Location: Located in West Portal. Parking available at meters or side streets.

Price: A little high for a scoop (around $2.50-$3.50 for one) but the ice cream is good quality).
author: Miss H K.

description: Megan summed this place up quite well.  This is the original -and one of only two remaining - locations of what had formerly been a candy empire with 50+ shops spanning Northern California.  They still make their own fudge in this shop, but the rest of the candy is shipped over from the factory and headquarters in Millbrae.  Please stop in and patronize this shop if you get a chance, because there aren't that many of these cute old-fashioned mom-and-pop candy/ice cream shops anymore, most having been overwhelmed by Ben and Jerry's, Double Rainbow (there's one down the street), and Baskin Robbins (yuck).
author: Rick H.

description:
Shaw's is among the last local candy shops around. It is always a treat to stop in and experience the aroma and array of fresh made candy. It is one of the shops that really makes going to West Portal special. 

My favorite is the rocky road candy and the ice cream is good too.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Shaw's is a nice break from the plethora of upscale candy shops that dot the city.  There are no artisan flavors, just the basics.  You won't miss any of the fru-fru attitude.

Homemade fudge and candies along side a wall of Pez, Jelly Belly and a counter stocked with every kind of old fashioned candy you can think of.  They even sell pink popcorn!  And lego chocolates!

Did I mention the Mitchel's ice cream?
So why aren't you on your way out the door RIGHT NOW?
author: Natalie R.

description: Looooooove this place !!!! I have had the pleasure of growing up in this neighborhood.  As a child I often saved my lunch money for weeks just so I can go to Shaw's and buy candy & ice cream !!! and trust me I was only in like the 3rd grade, so yes it was weeks ! Recently drove through West Portal and it was so nice to see that after all these years Shaw's was still there.
author: Richelle P.

description: Along with the Manor, Shaw's has to be one of the more quintessential West Portal spots, seeing as it's been here for something like 75 years, and still has that mid-century, small-town feel that West Portal is (increasingly inaccurately) known for.  It's just a tiny little mom 'n' pop place with a long display of chocolates and candies (including an ice-cream-less take on rocky road), and an ice cream counter in the back.  Even though I was here on a cold, dreary winter's day, the black walnut ice cream still managed to hit the spot (but if only they would invent a way to serve the stuff hot).  Suggestion: how about turning it into a full-fledged soda parlor with stools and such?  As it is, it's strictly takeout.
author: Wes M.

description: This shop reminds me of the old fashioned candy/ice cream store I'd go to as a kid.  They carry many different candies and delicious Mitchell's ice cream.  The owner is very, very nice and will let you sample the ice cream until you know what you want.  He's very personable and makes each customer feel welcome.  I think the prices are a bit expensive, but I don't frequent these fattening places often, so I might be behind the  times.  Also, while Yelp and the website says he's open until 7 pm,, he's actually open til 10 pm.  I highly recommend this shop for quality, selection, friendliness and calories!
author: Roberta B.

description:
I love Shaws. I've been going there for as long as I can remember and my mom before me. They are an institution. They have every odd candy you've been craving, 10 different kinds of licorice, milk chocolate non pareills, etc. It's reasonably priced still too.

I do miss more of the knick knacks from the previous owner and the hand packaged items for each holiday but overall, I still love it and stop by when I am craving an ice cream float or the mint meltaway thingys. 

Yay to neighborhood stores!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Ahh.... another favorite establishment from the good ol' childhood days. How did I neglect to write a review for Shaw's? Anywhoooo...

Conveniently and centrally located in the heart of West Portal, I would come here almost everyday after ELEMENTARY school and lust after the sweet confections through the glass window. Yes friends, this charming little place has been a West Portal staple for God knows how long. Doing the math... I beckon to say that Shaw's has been around for at least twenty years. The ownership/management has changed here and there, but the quality of fudge, ice cream and candies still remain the same. 

So why is this place a favorite of mine? Other than carrying a variety of Mitchell's ice cream, Shaw's has a wide selection of OLD SCHOOL CANDY. Expect to walk in and find a bunch of your classic goodies... ranging from candy bars to pop-into-your-mouth type stuff. Do you remember Sugar Daddy? 

I'm happy and pleasantly surprised to say that as much as I frequent Shaw's, I am still cavity free. *knock on wood* Don't forget to floss and brush, kids!
author: Teresa Y.

description:
Loved Shaws as a kid, love Shaws as an adult!! Mitchell's ice cream, homemade fudge, all the yummy candies I grew up with....so good! 
Customer service is excellent as well!
author: JoeAnne L.

description: This is a regular destination for me and my 6-year-old.  She loves it and so so I.  They should have some sort of customer loyalty program but maybe you don't need one when the sugar is doing all your sweet-talking.
author: Geoffrey C.

description: It's a quirky place, an old-time candy store, has obviously been here a long time, and looks like it from the decor, but the candy and chocolate are great (they have plenty of tasty modern confections).  I especially love the industrial/bulk jelly bean dispenser, and service is friendly. A great place to get your chocolate fix, and feel like you're back in time a few decades.
author: Syd S.

description: Crap, drove by Mitchell's Ice Cream and it's always packed no Avocado nor New York Cherry ice cream for me tonight. On the way home and ahh, Starbucks for desert nice sweetened iced coffee with a baked good sounds about right but wait, what's this? Shaw's was still opened and this place reminds me of the Manor Coffee shop right down the street. The striped awning is inviting and the colorful candies in their clear containers that lined the hallway to the ice cream bliss display said forget Starbucks ice cream is back on the agenda. No way...New York Cherry! from Mitchell's...here??!! ok one scoop in a cup with chocolate drizzle shell sounds good. The lady behind the counter hooked it up big time. I guess it was because it was close to closing time but I was amazed at the size of the one scoop. Jesus...if I were extremely lactose intolerant I would have died of gaseous overbloating! No complaints here this is the ice cream spot for me to avoid the lines at Mitchell's and maybe I might try some candy. I left the girl a tip for the enormous scoops we got and will be going back soon. Oh yeah the wife had a scoop of I don't know wasn't worried about it since all I was paying attention to was the cup of goodness I was about to experience but here again one enormous scoop on a sugar cone. Truly a new fan
author: graham c.

description: I come here for my fix of chocolate covered gummy bears and other miscelaneous gummy candies! They offer a pretty extensive assortment of candies, fudge and ice cream!! The ladies who work there are also pretty nice. Shaw's gets 4 stars in my book!
author: Minie J.

description: I remember after school i'd go here and indulge my sweet tooth, i know that sugar is bad for me but I cant help it! This is one few places I know in SF that has a jelly belly dispenser with all the flavors! Every other week I grab a bag and fill 'er up! If jelly bellies aren't your thing, they have fudge bars and candied nuts in baggies. On a hot summer day there's a back counter with Mitchell's ice cream by the cone! Roughly $4 for a scoop but those 'scoops' are big! Oh and support local businesses people!
author: Lola L.

description:
I actually like old candy. You know like lollipops that have been sitting on the shelves for over a year and it's not hard anymore but more chewy. I like it the texture.  I bought two lollipops that were this condition and I was happy as a bug eating it.

What I don't get is why the woman behind the counter had her baby stuck to her chest and could hardly squat to get to the candy I wanted.  I felt bad asking her for the darn dot candy.

Secondly, I bought 5 pieces of candy which came out to $19 and she didn't ring anything up. It was all in her head.  I paid via credit card so there is proof of transaction but it still rather sketchy.

I love candy (see my tag line) but I can get it less expensive in a number of different places.
author: Mona B.

description: Ok, so I always tell people I do not eat candy. I think chocolate does not count as candy. Don't you agree? I've been hooked on chocolate covered gummi bears since high school.  I know it sounds like a gross combination, but trust me- they're good. I use to get them at Sweet factory in Stonestown. My boyfriend knows that I love them and he knew about Shaw's and he decided to get me a pound of chocolate covered gummi bears. Wow they're are good, because they are fresh! No stale chocolate and old gummi bears. The truffles are great here too! The service is always with a smile, which makes it even sweeter. Oh, did I mention there's Mitchell's ice cream there, too? Let me know what you think of the chocolate covered gummi bears.
author: carebear l.

description: Shaw's is fantastic; what more could you want from a candy store. Convenient location and the treats are great.  Thank God, I have a great dentist I sure do a number on my teeth! Shaw's even has Mitchell's ice cream, Yeah!  You do not have to go all the way to San Jose Ave if you live near West Portal. Not to mention the owner is sweet and very friendly; the best small neighborhood candy store by far.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Would patron this establishment by choice. They sell quality chocolate that is very fresh and delicious. If your gonna do something wrong you might as well do it right. Kind of Pricey but good once in a while. I always get the rocky road chunk.
author: Keit K.

description: I LOVE SHAW'S!!! Each time I go to the city and stay at a friend's, I stop by Shaw's. They have candy galore and although tempting, I always bypass the chocolates, licorice and such to save all of my stomach room for Mitchell's!!!! They carry Mitchell's ice cream, which, in my opinion deserves 5 stars on its own! If you don't know about Mitchell's, you need to hurry on over to their actual store..... or Shaw's!
author: PauLine R.

description: My secret source of Mitchell's ice cream, since the lines down in the Mission can get insane!
author: Marissa V.

description: expensive, but delicious. great ice cream and an amazing array of candy to pick from. they have pretty much any good type of candy u can want, the place is very clean, and the worker is always rlly friendly.
author: Nikita K.

description: One of the more iconic candy shops in town, and an SF institution. It's changed ownership a few times, and the most recent buyers have done an apparently excellent job. All kinds of candies, homemade to pre-packaged, vintage classics like peppermint sticks, and fresh fudge make this a sweet-lover's paradise. They also serve Mitchell's Ice Cream and use it in milkshakes. That's a good time.
author: Megan W.

description: I've been going to Shaw's ever since I was a young child and I can still to theis day find something that makes any bad day good.  Shaw's has a very large selection of candy and chocolate and ice-cream that will brighten anyone's day.  Ever since I was a child, I have always bought a pound or two of gummy or sour candies as well as some chocolate.  I have to admit that it is a little pricey compared to candy I can buy from other stores, but I don't mind paying because this is candy I cannot find at another store.
author: Lisa H.

description: Wide array of homemade fudge + ice cream + old fashioned signage x $3.00 / two people - all your worries = nice sunny afternoon outing!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
I was in the mood for salt water taffy, having bought a great bag two weeks ago at Tower Market called Orthodox Chews (yes, I think they're kosher.) But I stopped in at Shaw's which is more or less in my neighborhood.
I made the mistake of buying two bags without asking the price. I mean, how expensive can taffy be? Well, at Shaw's it was over $21. I figured this must be very special taffy.
How can I express my disappointment? The first taffy was peanut butter: gritty, no chew, it just sat in my mouth and kind of melted. OK, maybe peanut butter isn't the best taffy ingredient. I pawed through the bag looking for traditional flavors. Not a single vanilla, the quintessential salt water taffy flavor. No chocolate, zero, nada. There has to be a peppermint! There was but mild without the zip that Jersey taffy has. 
Consistency and texture was awful: soft, not at all the kind of taffy I was looking for (and which I found at Orthodox Chews.) In sum, a total waste of money. Shaw's may be good for fudge and Mitchell's ice cream but order your taffy via internet from Atlantic City!
author: David F.

description: I remember coming here after school in the '90s for the slushies. Suicide slushie!!! The candy is kind of expensive, and honestly, it doesn't seem that busy everytime I walk by now, so I'm kind of surprised it's still in business today.
author: erica w.

description: LOVE this place! The day I went seemed to be booming business for ice cream (it was during our recent little "heat wave"), and naturally everyone in line was a-hankerin' for some cool relief. I love its time warp-like decor... the fixtures, signs that have probably been there since it first opened, and so much more. It was like I wasn't in the big city. Even though my ice cream was $3.50, I got a nice big scoop of Mexican Chocolate (Mitchell's brand... mmmm...) on a cone, and it was delicious. The lady who gave me my ice cream was gracious and generous with the ice cream... what's not to love? Besides, it's not like there are any other ice cream/candy shops in West Portal, so this is the place to be.
author: Caroline L.

description: Since many candy stores have gone out of business we ended up at Shaw's for my daughter's b-day party candy. I have two objections to this place. One-The prices of the candy are not labeled so make sure you ask because even though they have only a small amount to choose from, the prices per pound vary up to  a $2.00  difference. ($8.95-10.95.) Second- The woman that waited on us said she"gave" me more than a pound amounting to $11.95. I asked her to put it back because I only wanted a pound and she had not asked me. It was only on inquiring that I found out about the differences in prices, it was not volunteered. The extra dollar added to my purchase without consent bugged me enough that I will probably not go back.
author: Janet H.

description: i don't eat candy anymore, but if i did i would get it from here. i told the guy working that it reminded me of the movie willy wonka. you know, in the beginning where they sing about how the candy man can? maybe i just love glass jars. anyway, i come here for the ice cream- mitchell's ice cream. strawberries and cream. YUM.
author: Oleya P.

description: I love this place.  I am really addicted to the grasshopper pie ice cream and I usually bring a box of the chocolate caramel pecan turtles to dinner parties, and they are always a hit.
author: Rachel R.

description: this place is awesome!!! best ice cream place i have ever been to! the fudge is also pretty good.
author: neil r.

description: this is a great little neighborhood candy shop...thank God, since this is my new neighborhood.  there are few things i will call myself an expert on, but i am certain i am an expert on chocolate consumption.  i can go both ways with chocolate; old fashioned american or ultra modern haute couture chocolate which seems to be taking the world by storm.  this is a great place to get some old fashioned fudge.  i am very picky when it comes to fudge and this stuff did not disappoint.  i would highly recommend the rocky road.
author: Tammy N.

description: its a pretty cool little old time shop but the service is so bad .they are kind of mean after about 1 minute of waiting for some1 who was in the back.you would think  they'd be nice ,i mean its a candy shop.
author: avery N.

description: I just went in today to get Easter goodies and was very disappointed. First, much of their stuff is clearly not made by them, they buy it in bulk and then mark it up. Second, the prices were out of this world. $10.00 for a small chocolate bunny? $7.00 for a small bag of jelly bellies? Simply not worth it.
author: LH N.

description: I love their collection of candy. I usually order ice cream but I sometimes end up buying some candy for my buddies. I wish I knew about this place as a kid.
author: bob k.

description:
mmmmm mmmmm mmmmm

best chocolate covered gummi bears ever!!! The woman working in there is also super sweet!
author: Bob S.
